intro: Seseli coreanum, commonly known as Korean seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to East Asia, particularly Korea, and is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Seseli coreanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
